data.title: Age, Birthday, Biography, and Social Media
data.meta_description: Discover the profile of Cher, including age, birthday, zodiac sign, and social media accounts: Facebook, X, YouTube, Instagram.
data.text:
Cher's fame can be traced back to her early years in the music industry, where she formed a legendary partnership with her husband, Sonny Bono. The duo created a unique blend of pop and folk music, which captivated audiences and catapulted them to stardom in the 1960s. One of their most iconic songs, "I Got You Babe," became an instant hit and solidified Cher's status as a talented vocalist. With her distinct husky voice, striking beauty, and bold fashion choices, Cher quickly became a fashion and style icon of the era. As the duo disbanded in the 1970s, Cher embarked on a successful solo career, reinventing herself and experimenting with different musical genres. From ballads to disco anthems, Cher consistently pushed boundaries and remained relevant throughout the decades, ultimately becoming an entertainment icon and a symbol of resilience and reinvention. Her fame extends beyond music, with a successful acting career and various humanitarian endeavors, solidifying her status as a true legend in the world of entertainment.

Cher, born Cherilyn Sarkisian on May 20, 1946, in El Centro, California, is an iconic singer, actress, and entertainer. With a career spanning over six decades, Cher has established herself as a cultural phenomenon and one of the best-selling music artists of all time. She rose to fame in the 1960s as part of the duo Sonny & Cher, known for their hit song "I Got You Babe." Cher later embarked on a successful solo music career, releasing chart-topping hits such as "Believe" and "If I Could Turn Back Time." In addition to her music career, Cher has also displayed her versatility as an actress, winning an Academy Award for her role in the film "Moonstruck." Throughout her career, Cher has continued to push boundaries and reinvent herself, becoming a fashion icon and LGBTQ+ advocate. With her distinctive contralto voice, bold fashion choices, and fearless attitude, Cher remains a beloved and influential figure in the entertainment industry.

Cher, born Cherilyn Sarkisian, is the daughter of John Sarkisian, a truck driver, and Georgia Holt, an actress and occasional model. Cher's parents divorced when she was young, and her mother remarried several times. Cher has two half-siblings, a half-sister Georganne LaPiere and a half-brother who passed away in infancy. Cher has been married twice, first to musician Sonny Bono with whom she has a daughter, Chastity Bono (now known as Chaz Bono). After her divorce from Sonny, Cher was in a relationship with musician Gregg Allman and they have a son, Elijah Blue Allman. Cher also has a son, Elijah Blue Allman. Throughout her career as a singer, actress, and pop culture icon, Cher has continued to make a name for herself and remains a beloved figure in the entertainment industry.
